name: df-curf
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7
body: |- wceq(ccurf, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, csb(s2, cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), csb(s3, cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cop(cmpt(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), cop(cmpt(s5, cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), co(cv(s4), cfv(c1st, cv(s1)), cv(s5))), cmpo(s5, s6, cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), cmpt(s7, co(cv(s5), cfv(chom, cv(s3)), cv(s6)), co(cfv(cfv(ccid, cv(s2)), cv(s4)), co(cop(cv(s4), cv(s5)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)), cop(cv(s4), cv(s6))), cv(s7)))))), cmpo(s4, s5, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), cmpt(s7, co(cv(s4), cfv(chom, cv(s2)), cv(s5)), cmpt(s6, cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), co(cv(s7), co(cop(cv(s4), cv(s6)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)), cop(cv(s5), cv(s6))), cfv(cfv(ccid, cv(s3)), cv(s6)))))))))))
comment: Define the curry functor, which maps a functor ` F : C X. D --> E ` to ` curryF ( F ) : C --> ( D --> E ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2017.)
